p: The energy crises of the early 1970s were driven by geopolitical rather than physical resource constraints but they appeared to confirm the neo-Malthusianism of Darling's lectures and earlier coverage such as the Panorama documentary strand specials The Challenge of the 60s. These events served to renew broadcaster appetites to engage with the issues around human numbers and environmental hazard, but the relatively rare explorations of per capita consumption focused not on the increasing intensity of the mainstream, but rather exotic and scarce examples of its opposite.
